category_system.description: Italian profanity categorization considering religious blasphemy, regional variations, and gesture integration
category_system.methodology: Based on Italian sociolinguistic research and cultural studies

general.name: Parolacce Generali
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration

subcategories.exclamatory: Words used for emphasis (cazzo, merda, mannaggia)

sexual.name: Contenuto Sessuale
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content

subcategories.anatomy: Sexual body parts (cazzo, fica, minchia, coglioni)
subcategories.prostitution: Terms related to sex work (puttana, troia)

religious.name: Bestemmie e Profanità Religiosa
religious.description: Blasphemous or sacrilegious language targeting religious beliefs

slurs.name: Insulti e Termini Dispregiativi
slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting specific groups or individuals
slurs.examples_note: Offensive terms for groups and individuals

hate_speech.name: Discorso d'Odio
hate_speech.description: Language targeting individuals or groups based on identity characteristics

body_parts.name: Parti del Corpo Inappropriate
body_parts.description: Crude or inappropriate references to body parts
body_parts.examples_note: Anatomical terms used inappropriately or crudely

scatological.name: Scatologico
scatological.description: References to bodily waste and bathroom functions

violence.name: Violenza e Aggressione
violence.description: Words promoting or describing violence, threats, or aggressive behavior

subcategories.threats: Direct or implied threats of harm
subcategories.weapons: References to weapons in threatening context

regional_slurs.name: Insulti Regionali
regional_slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting Italian regional groups

gesture_related.name: Correlati ai Gesti
gesture_related.description: Profanity specifically associated with hand gestures
gesture_related.examples_note: Words typically accompanied by specific Italian hand gestures

subcategories.pinched_fingers: Terms with questioning gesture (ma che cazzo)

1.description: Generally acceptable in casual conversation but may be filtered in formal settings
1.cultural_notes: Often used casually, especially in informal contexts

2.description: Inappropriate in most professional or public settings
2.cultural_notes: Context-dependent severity, varies by region and relationship

3.description: Highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts
3.cultural_notes: Clearly offensive across all Italian regions

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, or causing significant harm
4.cultural_notes: Hate speech level, can have legal consequences in Italy

northern_italy.tolerance_level: Higher tolerance for religious blasphemy, lower for regional slurs

southern_italy.tolerance_level: Lower tolerance for religious blasphemy, higher sensitivity to family honor

sicily.tolerance_level: Traditional Catholic values, distinct linguistic patterns

special_italian_features.blasphemy_hierarchy: Elaborate system of religious profanity with legal implications
special_italian_features.gesture_integration: Unique integration of verbal profanity with hand gestures
special_italian_features.regional_discrimination: North-South Italian regional slurs with historical context
special_italian_features.gender_agreement: All profanity follows Italian grammatical gender rules
special_italian_features.diminutive_system: Extensive use of diminutives and augmentatives in profanity

legal_framework.blasphemy_laws: Some extreme religious blasphemy can violate Italian law
legal_framework.hate_speech: Racial and ethnic slurs covered under Italian hate speech legislation
legal_framework.public_decency: Public usage can result in fines for disturbing public order
legal_framework.workplace_protection: Employment law protects against discriminatory language
